root.para: In many financial reporting frameworks, the best evidence of a financial instrumentâ€™s fair value is found in contemporaneous transactions in an active market (that is, level 1 inputs). In such cases, the valuation of a financial instrument may be relatively simple. Quoted prices for financial instruments that are listed on exchanges or traded in liquid OTC markets may be available from sources such as financial publications, the exchanges themselves, or third-party pricing sources. When using quoted prices, it is important that management understand the basis on which the quote is given to ensure that the price reflects market conditions at the measurement date.
